documentation.title: Switch Declaration
documentation.standard: This standard covers all switch declarations.
Case statements are indented with a single indent (tab) inside the switch statement.

code.title: Valid: Case statement is indent with one tab
Invalid: Case statement is indent with one space. Case statement is not indent at all or with two tabs.

documentation.standard: The code inside the case statements is further indented with a single (tab) indent.

code.title: Valid: The code is indent one more tab then case statement.
Invalid: The code is indent with spaces or with only one tab.

documentation.standard: The break statement is aligned with the code.

code.title: Valid: The break statement is aligned to the code.
Invalid: The break statement is not aligned with the code.

documentation.standard: Only one break statement is allowed per case.

code.title: Valid: Only one break statement per case
Invalid: Two case statements per case

documentation.standard: The default statement must be the last in the switch and must not have a break statement.

code.title: Valid: The default statement is the last in the switch and have no break statement.
Invalid: Default statement is not the last element and it contains a break.

documentation.standard: If one case block has to pass control into another case block without having a break, there must be a comment about it in the code.

code.title: Valid: The fall-through is explained with a comment
Invalid: No comment at the fall-through
